Yes, there are several pain management apps available for smartphones that can help with managing chronic pain. Here are some examples:

1. Curable: Curable is an app that offers pain education, mindfulness techniques, and exercises to help people manage their chronic pain.

2. My Pain Diary: My Pain Diary is an app that allows you to track your pain, medications, and activities to help you identify patterns and triggers for your chronic pain.

3. Calm: Calm is a meditation app that offers hundreds of guided meditations and calming music to help reduce stress and anxiety associated with chronic pain.

4. Headspace: Headspace is a meditation app that offers guided meditations and mindfulness techniques to reduce stress and anxiety and improve sleep, which can all help in managing chronic pain.

5. Pain Coach: Pain Coach is an app that offers personalized pain management plans, educational resources, and tools to track pain and other symptoms.

There are many other pain management apps available as well, so it's worth exploring to find the one that works best for you.
